dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 2573 IH: To express the Sense of Congress with respect to Federal preemption of State restrictions on dispensing medication abortion, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ryan (for himself, Mrs. Fletcher, Ms. Kuster, Mr. Deluzio, Ms. Perez, Mr. Torres of New York, Ms. Titus, Mrs. McClellan, Mr. Garamendi, Ms. Barragán, Mr. Payne, Ms. Scholten, Ms. Kamlager-Dove, Ms. Velázquez, Mrs. Trahan, Mrs. Watson Coleman, Ms. Meng, Ms. Clarke of New York, Mr. Boyle of Pennsylvania, Mrs. Sykes, Mr. Cleaver, Ms. Leger Fernandez, Mr. Magaziner, Ms. Wexton, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Norcross, Ms. Norton, Ms. Manning, Mr. Larsen of Washington, Mr. Nickel, Ms. Slotkin, Mr. Landsman, Mr. Goldman of New York, Ms. Caraveo, Ms. Porter, Mr. Casten, Ms. Wild, Ms. Jacobs, Ms. Craig, and Mr. Courtney) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To express the Sense of Congress with respect to Federal preemption of State restrictions on dispensing medication abortion, and for other purposes.

section.header: Sense of Congress regarding Federal preemption of State restrictions on dispensing medication abortion
section.text: It is the Sense of Congress that medication abortion was appropriately approved, and is appropriately regulated, under the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act (21 U.S.C. 301 et seq.), and that such approval under such Act preempts any State law establishing, implementing, or enforcing—

paragraph.text: any requirement that medication abortion be dispensed by a health care practitioner in person; or
any prohibition or restriction on prescribing or dispensing medication abortion by means of telehealth.
